measure.name: process_airflow
measure.description: This measure processes infiltration for the living space, garage, finished basement, unfinished basement, crawlspace, and unfinished attic. It also processes mechanical ventilation and natural ventilation for the living space.
measure.modeler_description: Using EMS code, this measure processes the building's airflow (infiltration, mechanical ventilation, and natural ventilation).

argument.name: selectedliving
argument.display_name: Which is the living space zone?

argument.name: userdefinedinflivingspace
argument.display_name: Air exchange rate, in Air Changes per Hour at 50 Pascals (ACH50), for above-grade living space (including finished attic).

argument.name: userdefinedconstinflivingspace
argument.display_name: Air exchange rate, in natural Air Changes per Hour (ACH), for above-grade living space. Using this variable will override the AIM-2 calculation method with a constant air exchange rate.

argument.name: userdefinedinfsheltercoef
argument.display_name: The local shelter coefficient (AIM-2 infiltration model) accounts for nearby buildings, trees and obstructions.

argument.name: selectedgarage
argument.display_name: Which is the garage zone?

argument.name: selectedfbsmt
argument.display_name: Which is the finished basement zone?

argument.name: userdefinedinffbsmt
argument.display_name: Constant air exchange rate, in Air Changes per Hour (ACH), for the finished basement.

argument.name: selectedufbsmt
argument.display_name: Which is the unfinished basement zone?

argument.name: userdefinedinfufbsmt
argument.display_name: Constant air exchange rate, in Air Changes per Hour (ACH), for the unfinished basement. A value of 0.10 ACH or greater is recommended for modeling Heat Pump Water Heaters in unfinished basements.

argument.name: selectedcrawl
argument.display_name: Which is the crawlspace zone?

argument.name: userdefinedinfcrawl
argument.display_name: Air exchange rate, in Air Changes per Hour at 50 Pascals (ACH50), for the crawlspace.

argument.name: selectedunfinattic
argument.display_name: Which is the unfinished attic zone?

argument.name: userdefinedinfunfinattic
argument.display_name: Ratio of the effective leakage area (infiltration and/or ventilation) in the unfinished attic to the total floor area of the attic.

argument.name: userdefinedneighboroffset
argument.display_name: The minimum distance between the simulated house and the neighboring houses (not including eaves) [ft].

argument.name: userdefinedhomeage
argument.display_name: Age of home [yrs]. Enter 0 for new construction.

argument.name: selectedterraintype
argument.display_name: Site terrain type.

argument.name: selectedventtype
argument.display_name: Ventilation strategy used (none, exhaust, supply, or balanced).

argument.name: selectedinfilcredit
argument.display_name: If True, the ASHRAE 62.2 infiltration credit will be included for buildings with infiltration that exceeds a default rate of 2 cfm per 100sqft of finished floor area.

argument.name: userdefinedtotaleff
argument.display_name: The net total energy (sensible plus latent, also called enthalpy) recovered by the supply airstream adjusted by electric consumption, case heat loss or heat gain, air leakage and airflow mass imbalance between the two airstreams, as a percent of the potential total energy that could be recovered plys the exhaust fan energy.

argument.name: userdefinedsenseff
argument.display_name: The net sensible energy recovered by the supply airstream as adjusted by electric consumption, case heat loss or heat gain, air leakage, airflow mass imbalance between the two airstreams and the energy used for defrost (when running the Very Low Temperature Test), as a percent of the potential sensible energy that could be recovered plus the exhaust fan energy.

argument.name: userdefinedfanpower
argument.display_name: Fan power (in W) per delivered airflow rate (in cfm) of fan(s) providing whole house ventilation. If the house uses a balanced ventilation system thtere is assumed to be two fans operating at this efficiency.

argument.name: userdefinedfracofashrae
argument.display_name: Fraction of the ventilation rate (including any infiltration credit) specified by 2010 ASHRAE 62.2 that is desired in the bulding.

argument.name: userdefineddryerexhaust
argument.display_name: Rated flow capacity of the clothes dryer exhaust. This fan is assumed to run 60 min/day between 11am and 12pm.

argument.name: userdefinedhtgoffset
argument.display_name: The temperature offset below the hourly cooling setpoint, to which the living space is allowed to cool during months that are only in the heating season [F].

argument.name: userdefinedclgoffset
argument.display_name: The temperature offset above the hourly heating setpoint, to which the living space is allowed to cool during months that are only in the cooling season [F].

argument.name: userdefinedovlpoffset
argument.display_name: The temperature offset above the maximum heating setpoint, to which the living space is allowed to cool during months that are in both the heating season and cooling season [F].

argument.name: selectedheatingssn
argument.display_name: True if windows are allowed to be opened during months that are only in the heating season.

argument.name: selectedcoolingssn
argument.display_name: True if windows are allowed to be opened during months that are only in the cooling season.

argument.name: selectedoverlapssn
argument.display_name: True if windows are allowed to be opened during months that are in both the heating season and cooling season.

argument.name: userdefinedventweekdays
argument.display_name: Number of weekdays in the week that natural ventilation can occur.

argument.name: userdefinedventweekenddays
argument.display_name: Number of weekend days in the week that natural ventilation can occur.

argument.name: userdefinedfracwinopen
argument.display_name: Specifies the fraction of the total openable window area in the building that is opened for ventilation.

argument.name: userdefinedfracwinareaopen
argument.display_name: Specifies the fraction of total window area in the home that can be opened (e.g. typical sliding windows can be opened to half of their area.

argument.name: userdefinedhumratio
argument.display_name: Outdoor air humidity ratio above which windows will not open for natural ventilation.

argument.name: userdefinedrelhumratio
argument.display_name: Outdoor air relative humidity (0-1) above which windows will not open for natural ventilation.

argument.name: num_bedrooms
argument.display_name: Number of bedrooms.

argument.name: num_bathrooms
argument.display_name: Number of bathrooms.

argument.name: finished_floor_area
argument.display_name: Finished floor area [ft^2].

argument.name: above_grade_finished_floor_area
argument.display_name: Above grade finished floor area [ft^2].

argument.name: building_height
argument.display_name: Height of building [ft].

argument.name: stories
argument.display_name: Number of stories.

argument.name: window_area
argument.display_name: Window area [ft^2].

argument.name: livingspacevolume
argument.display_name: Volume of living space [ft^3].

argument.name: livingspaceheight
argument.display_name: Height of living space [ft].

argument.name: livingspacearea
argument.display_name: Area of living space [ft^2].

argument.name: uavolume
argument.display_name: Volume of unfinished attic [ft^3].

argument.name: uaheight
argument.display_name: Height of unfinished attic [ft].

argument.name: uaarea
argument.display_name: Area of unfinished attic [ft^2].

argument.name: cvolume
argument.display_name: Volume of crawlspace [ft^3].

argument.name: cheight
argument.display_name: Height of crawlspace [ft].

argument.name: carea
argument.display_name: Area of crawlspace [ft^2].

argument.name: gvolume
argument.display_name: Volume of garage [ft^3].

argument.name: gheight
argument.display_name: Height of garage [ft].

argument.name: garea
argument.display_name: Area of garage [ft^2].

argument.name: fbvolume
argument.display_name: Volume of finished basement [ft^3].

argument.name: fbheight
argument.display_name: Height of finished basement [ft].

argument.name: fbarea
argument.display_name: Area of finished basement [ft^2].

argument.name: ufbvolume
argument.display_name: Volume of unfinished basement [ft^3].

argument.name: ufbheight
argument.display_name: Height of unfinished basement [ft].

argument.name: ufbarea
argument.display_name: Area of unfinished basement [ft^2].
